workflows.title: Workflows for building a project
workflows.description: You can use codemagic.yaml to define several workflows for building a project. Each workflow describes the entire build pipeline from triggers to publishing. For example, you may want to have separate workflows for developing, testing and publishing the app.

InstanceType.title: InstanceType
InstanceType.description: Build machine type to use for the build.

TriggeringEvent.title: TriggeringEvent
TriggeringEvent.description: Currently supported events are push, pull_request, tag, pull_request_labeled.

pattern.title: Exact value or glob pattern to search for a branch
pattern.description: The pattern can also be passed with an environment variable.
pattern.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected an integer, float, boolean or nonempty string

include.title: Include the pattern
include.description: If set to false, the matching branches will not be watched for triggering events.

source.title: Specify whether the watched branch is the source or the target of the pull request
source.description: The variable is ignored for events other than pull_request.

pattern.title: Exact value or glob pattern to search for a tag
pattern.description: The pattern can also be passed with an environment variable.
pattern.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected an integer, float, boolean or nonempty string

include.title: Include the pattern
include.description: If set to false, the matching tags will not be watched for triggering events.

events.title: List the events that trigger builds
events.description: Currently supported events are push, pull_request, tag, pull_request_labeled, pull_request_labelled.

branch_patterns.title: Branch patterns
branch_patterns.description: A branch pattern can match the name of a particular branch, or you can use wildcard symbols to create a pattern that matches several branches. Note that for pull request builds you have to specify whether the watched branch is the source or the target of the pull request.
branch_patterns.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a not empty list of dictionaries

tag_patterns.title: Tag patterns
tag_patterns.description: A tag pattern can match the name of a particular tag, or you can use wildcard symbols to create a pattern that matches several tags.
tag_patterns.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a not empty list of dictionaries

cancel_previous_builds.title: Cancel previous builds
cancel_previous_builds.description: To avoid running builds on outdated commits, set cancel_previous_builds to true to automatically cancel all ongoing and queued builds triggered by webhooks on push or pull request commit when a more recent build has been triggered for the same branch.

description.title: Input description
description.description: A description for this input parameter. Description is displayed in Codemagic when manually starting a build for this workflow and user is prompted to provide values for the inputs.

type.title: Input type
type.description: Defines the data type of the input parameter. This must be one of: `boolean`, `choice`, `number` or `string`. By default, `string` is assumed. Input values for the `choice` type are resolved to strings and must be defined in the `options` field. Values for inputs with types `boolean` and `number` are persisted as booleans and integers or floating point numbers respectively, instead of converting them to strings as long as they are not used directly in string interpolations.

options.title: Choice options
options.description: Provide a list of values as options for the `choice` input. Required if type is `choice` and prohibited otherwise.

default.title: Default value for non-required input
default.description: Provide a default value for the input parameter. Must be specified if the input is not required and prohibited otherwise.

profile.title: Profile reference
profile.description: Profile reference found in Team settings -> Code signing identities

environment_variable.title: Environment variable
environment_variable.description: Name of the variable containing the profile path

certificate.title: Certificate reference
certificate.description: Certificate reference found in Team settings -> Code signing identities

environment_variable.title: Environment variable
environment_variable.description: Name of the variable containing the certificate path

distribution_type.title: Distribution type
distribution_type.description: Type of certificates and profiles to fetch from Code signing identities
distribution_type.errorMessage: Incorrect distribution type. Expected one of ad_hoc, app_store, development, enterprise

bundle_identifier.title: Bundle identifier
bundle_identifier.description: Bundle identifier of certificates and profiles to fetch from Code signing identities

provisioning_profiles.title: Provisioning profiles
provisioning_profiles.description: Provisioning profiles to fetch from Code signing identities
provisioning_profiles.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected list of strings or dictionaries

certificates.title: Certificates
certificates.description: Certificates to fetch from Code signing identities
certificates.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected list of strings or dictionaries

keystore.title: Keystore reference
keystore.description: Keystore reference found in Team settings -> Code signing identities

keystore_environment_variable.title: Keystore environment variable
keystore_environment_variable.description: Name of the variable containing the keystore path

keystore_password_environment_variable.title: Keystore password environment variable
keystore_password_environment_variable.description: Name of the variable containing the keystore password

key_alias_environment_variable.title: Key alias environment variable
key_alias_environment_variable.description: Name of the variable containing the key alias

key_password_environment_variable.title: Key password environment variable
key_password_environment_variable.description: Name of the variable containing the key password

version.title: Flutter version
version.description: Define the channel name, version (e.g. v1.13.4) or 'fvm' if using Flutter Version Management.

flavor.title: Flutter flavor
flavor.description: The name of the flavor to use when using FVM.

vars.title: Environment variables
vars.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a dictionary with integer, float, boolean or nonempty string as values

groups.title: Environment variable groups
groups.description: Define environment variable group names that have been configured in app or team settings.
groups.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a list of nonempty strings

ios_signing.title: iOS code signing identities
ios_signing.description: iOS code signing identities configured under Team settings

android_signing.title: Android code signing identities
android_signing.description: Android code signing identities configured under Team settings

xcode.title: Xcode version
xcode.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected an integer, float or nonempty string

ubuntu.title: Ubuntu
ubuntu.description: Define the Ubuntu version to use for the build.
ubuntu.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected an integer, float or nonempty string

cocoapods.title: CocoaPods version
cocoapods.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected an integer, float or nonempty string

node.title: Node version
node.description: Define default, latest, current, lts, carbon (or another stream), nightly or version (e.g. 12.4.0).
node.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected an integer, float or nonempty string

npm.title: Npm version
npm.description: Define default, latest, next, lts or version (e.g. 6.13.7).
npm.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected an integer, float or nonempty string

ndk.title: Ndk revision
ndk.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected an integer, float or nonempty string

java.title: Java platform version
java.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected an integer, float or nonempty string

ruby.title: Ruby platform version
ruby.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected an integer, float or nonempty string

flutter.title: Flutter version
flutter.description: Define the channel name, version (e.g. v1.13.4) or 'fvm' if using Flutter Version Management.
flutter.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected an integer, float, nonempty string or dictionary

unity.title: Unity version
unity.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a nonempty string

app_store_connect.title: Use info from Apple Developer Portal integration
app_store_connect.description: Specify the name of the App Store Connect API key to be used from team or personal integrations to authenticate actions for code signing and publishing.

cache_paths.title: Paths to be cached
cache_paths.description: For example, you may consider caching the following paths: "$FLUTTER_ROOT/.pub-cache" for Dart cache, "$HOME/.gradle/caches" for gradle cache, "$HOME/Library/Caches/CocoaPods" for CocoaPods cache.
cache_paths.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a list of nonempty strings

changeset.title: Watched paths or path patterns
changeset.description: List of paths or path patterns to watch for changes, proceed if changes are detected.

condition.title: Condition
condition.description: Check if condition evaluates to true before proceeding with building workflow or script.

ScriptOnFailure.title: ScriptOnFailure
ScriptOnFailure.description: The only supported action is to proceed directly to publishing.

script.title: Script to be executed
script.description: By default the script will be run in the Bash shell. You can run the script in other languages by defining a shebang line in the beginning.

name.title: Script name
name.description: A descriptive script name can be provided to be shown in the UI. If not passed, the first line of your script will be shown in the UI for the script block.
name.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected an integer, float, boolean or nonempty string

ignore_failure.title: Ignore script failure
ignore_failure.description: If set to true, the workflow will continue to run even if the script fails.

on_failure.title: The action to take on script failure
on_failure.description: The only supported action is to proceed directly to publishing.

when.title: Conditions for script to continue
when.description: All conditions below should be met in order for script to continue.

working_directory.title: Script working directory
working_directory.description: Specify directory where this script will be executed. It overrides global workflow working directory.

script.title: Script to be executed
script.description: By default the script will be run in the Bash shell. You can run the script in other languages by defining a shebang line in the beginning.

name.title: Script name
name.description: A descriptive script name can be provided to be shown in the UI. If not passed, the first line of your script will be shown in the UI for the script block.
name.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected an integer, float, boolean or nonempty string

ignore_failure.title: Ignore script failure
ignore_failure.description: If set to true, the workflow will continue to run even if the script fails.

on_failure.title: The action to take on script failure
on_failure.description: The only supported action is to proceed directly to publishing.

when.title: Conditions for script to continue
when.description: All conditions below should be met in order for script to continue.

working_directory.title: Script working directory
working_directory.description: Specify directory where this script will be executed. It overrides global workflow working directory.

test_report.title: Exact name or glob pattern matching the test result file location
test_report.description: You can display test results visually in the build overview. The value can be an absolute path, or a path relative to $CM_BUILD_DIR (in this case the patterns will be searched recursively). Supported test report formats are Junit XML and .JSON for Flutter's --machine report.

success.title: Publish on success
success.description: Set to false to not receive a notification when a build succeeds.

failure.title: Publish on failure
failure.description: Set to false to not receive a notification when a build fails.

recipients.title: List the email addresses to notify about build results

notify.title: Email notification settings
notify.description: Allows to turn on or turn off email notification on build success or failure.

channel.title: Specify the Slack channel for publishing
channel.description: To allow publishing to private channels, invite the Codemagic Slack app to the channels by writing @codemagic in the channel.

notify_on_build_start.title: Send a Slack notification when a build starts
notify_on_build_start.description: When you set notify_on_build_start to true, the channel will be notified when a build starts.

notify.title: Slack notification settings
notify.description: Allows to turn on or turn off slack notification on build success or failure.

auth.title: App Store Connect authentication method
auth.description: Accepted value: integration. When defined, the API key info inherited from integrations is used for authenticating with App Store Connect. If you omit this key-value pair, you must define API key, key identifier and issuer identifier explicitly.

api_key.title: App Store Connect API key
api_key.description: App Store Connect API key in .p8 format that is used for authenticating application packages validation and upload to App Store Connect. It is required for TestFlight submission.
api_key.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a string in the form of an encrypted value, environment variable or plain text

key_id.title: App Store Connect API key identifier
key_id.description: App Store Connect API key identifier that is used for authenticating application packages validation and upload to App Store Connect. It is required for TestFlight submission.
key_id.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a string in the form of an encrypted value, environment variable or plain text

issuer_id.title: App Store Connect API key issuer identifier
issuer_id.description: App Store Connect API key issuer identifier that is used for authenticating application packages validation and upload to App Store Connect. It is required for TestFlight submission.
issuer_id.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a string in the form of an encrypted value, environment variable or plain text

apple_id.title: Apple ID
apple_id.description: The email address used to log in to App Store Connect. It can also be passed with an environment variable.
apple_id.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a string in the form of an encrypted value, environment variable or plain text email

password.title: App-specific password
password.description: App-specific passwords allow you to sign in to your account securely when you use third-party apps with your Apple ID. e.g. ujlw-ypqu-dgzw-vyog. The plain or encrypted password can also be passed with en environment variable.
password.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a string in the form of an encrypted value, environment variable or plain text password

submit_to_testflight.title: Submit uploaded application package to Testflight
submit_to_testflight.description: Submit published build to Testflight. Requires authentication using App Store Connect API key.

expire_build_submitted_for_review.title: Expire previous build submitted to review before submitting package to Testflight
expire_build_submitted_for_review.description: Expire previously submitted build that is in review before submitting published build to Testflight. Requires authentication using App Store Connect API key.

beta_groups.title: Release uploaded application package to the groups of beta testers
beta_groups.description: Published build will be made available to the specified Beta groups in App Store Connect. TestFlight submission is required in order to release builds to the groups of beta testers.

submit_to_app_store.title: Submit uploaded application package to App Store review
submit_to_app_store.description: Submit published build to App Store review. Requires authentication using App Store Connect API key.

cancel_previous_submissions.title: Cancel previous submissions before submitting application package to App Store review
cancel_previous_submissions.description: Cancel previous submissions before submitting application package to App Store review. Requires authentication using App Store Connect API key.

release_type.title: Specify when to release the app after App Store review
release_type.description: Choose when to release the app. You can either manually release the app at a later date on the App Store Connect website, or the app version can be automatically released right after it has been approved by App Review.
release_type.errorMessage: Incorrect release type. Expected one of MANUAL, AFTER_APPROVAL, SCHEDULED

earliest_release_date.title: Specify earliest return date for scheduled release type
earliest_release_date.description: Specify earliest return date for scheduled release type. Timezone aware ISO8601 timestamp, for example 2021-11-10T14:55:41+00:00.
earliest_release_date.errorMessage: Not a valid timezone aware ISO8601 timestamp

copyright.title: The name of the person or entity that owns the exclusive rights to your app
copyright.description: The name of the person or entity that owns the exclusive rights to your app, preceded by the year the rights were obtained (for example, "2008 Acme Inc."). Do not provide a URL.
copyright.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a string in the form of an environment variable or plain text

phased_release.title: Specify if App Store version update should be released in phases
phased_release.description: Whether or not to release an App Store version update in phases. With this option turned on, your version update will be released over a 7-day period to a percentage of your users (selected at random by their Apple ID) with automatic updates turned on. Learn more from https://developer.apple.com/help/app-store-connect/update-your-app/release-a-version-update-in-phases. If not specified, then the default phased release configuration for the App Store version is reused.

track.title: Name of the track to which release is promoted
track.description: The track to promote the release to. Used in conjunction with the 'track` argument.

rollout_fraction.title: Rollout fraction
rollout_fraction.description: The promoted release in the target track will be staged, allowing users to choose which fraction of the testers or users get access to the application. To release to everyone, omit the rollout_fraction field.

promote_as_draft.title: Promote the release with draft status
promote_as_draft.description: Indicates that the promoted release will be in the draft status in the target track.

credentials.title: Service account credentials
credentials.description: The encrypted JSON key file or the encrypted contents of the JSON key file. The value can also be passed with an environment variable.

release_name.title: The release name
release_name.description: Not required to be unique. If not set, the name is generated from the APK's versionName.

track.title: Name of the track
track.description: Codemagic enables you to automatically publish your app to Google Play.

in_app_update_priority.title: Priority of the release
in_app_update_priority.description: If your application supports in-app updates, set the release priority by specifying an integer in range [0, 5]. Otherwise, in_app_update_priority can be omitted.

rollout_fraction.title: Rollout fraction
rollout_fraction.description: Codemagic supports staged releases, allowing users to choose which fraction of the testers or users get access to the application. To release to everyone, omit the rollout_fraction field.

changes_not_sent_for_review.title: Do not send changes for review
changes_not_sent_for_review.description: Indicates that the changes in this edit will not be reviewed until they are explicitly sent for review from the Google Play Console UI.

submit_as_draft.title: Create the release in draft status
submit_as_draft.description: Indicates that the artifacts generated in the build will be uploaded to Google Play as a draft release.

release_promotion.title: Release promotion
release_promotion.description: Additionally, promote the uploaded release to another track

app_id.title: Firebase application id
app_id.description: Firebase application id found in Firebase application settings.

groups.title: Groups to be distributed to
groups.description: Test groups that the application should be distributed to.
groups.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a list of nonempty strings

artifact_type.title: Preferable Android artifact type
artifact_type.description: Artifact type (aab/apk) to prioritize when uploading to Firebase App Distribution, by default app bundles are prioritized.

firebase_token.title: Firebase access token
firebase_token.description: Firebase access token generated using Firebase CLI; to receive the token use firebase login:ci with Firebase CLI installed.

firebase_service_account.title: Service account with Firebase distribution permission
firebase_service_account.description: The content of service account file that has "Firebase App Distribution Admin" role.

ios.title: iOS
ios.description: Codemagic enables you to automatically publish your iOS app to Firebase App Distribution.

android.title: android
android.description: Codemagic enables you to automatically publish your Android app to Firebase App Distribution.

store_id.title: Partner Center store ID
store_id.description: Store ID set up on Microsoft Partner Center.

tenant_id.title: Partner Center tenant id
tenant_id.description: Directory (tenant) ID in Azure AD portal.

client_id.title: Partner Center client id
client_id.description: Application (client) ID in Azure AD portal.

client_secret.title: Partner Center client secret
client_secret.description: The value of the Azure AD app key.

email.title: Email
email.description: If the build finishes successfully, release notes (if passed) and the generated artifacts will be published to the provided email address(es). If the build fails, an email with a link to build logs will be sent.

slack.title: Slack
slack.description: Integrate Slack publishing into your Codemagic build pipeline to get notified when a build starts and receive build artifacts or logs when the build finishes. To set up publishing to Slack, you first need to connect your Slack workspace in User integrations for personal apps and in Team integrations for team apps.

app_store_connect.title: App Store Connect
app_store_connect.description: Codemagic enables you to automatically publish your iOS app to App Store Connect for beta testing with TestFlight or distributing the app to users via App Store.

google_play.title: Google Play
google_play.description: Codemagic enables you to automatically publish your app to the internal, alpha, beta and production tracks on Google Play. In order to do so, you will need to set up a service account in Google Play Console and add the JSON key file to your Codemagic configuration file.

firebase.title: Firebase
firebase.description: Codemagic enables you to automatically publish your app to Firebase App Distribution. In order to do so, set up an account and project on Firebase and provide Codemagic with your Firebase token, Firebase app id and test groups.

partner_center.title: Partner Center
partner_center.description: Codemagic enables you to automatically publish your app to Microsoft Store. In order to do so, set up an account and project on Microsoft Partner Center and provide Codemagic with your store id, client id, client secret and tenant id.

scripts.title: Custom post-publishing scripts
scripts.description: Add scripts to publish to any other service.
scripts.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a non-empty list of strings (inline script) or dictionaries (scripts with additional fields)

tester_groups.title: Tester groups
tester_groups.description: List the tester groups that will receive new versions of the application.
tester_groups.errorMessage: At least one group name is required

name.title: Workflow name
name.description: Workflow name displayed in the Codemagic UI.

instance_type.title: Instance type
instance_type.description: Build machine type to use for the build.

max_build_duration.title: Build timeout settings
max_build_duration.description: By default, Codemagic builds are set to time out after 60 minutes. You can decrease or increase the maximum build duration.

triggering.title: Automatic build triggering for watched branches
triggering.description: Triggering defines the events for automatic build triggering and watched branches. If no events are defined, you can start builds only manually.

inputs.title: Build inputs
inputs.description: Define input properties that are passed to the workflow when starting a build. Build inputs can be specified when starting a build either manually from Codemagic user interface or by sending HTTP request to Codemagic API.

environment.title: Build environment
environment.description: Environment contains all the environment variables and enables to specify the version of Flutter, Xcode, CocoaPods, Node, npm, ndk, Java and Ruby used for building. This is also where you can add credentials and API keys required for code signing. Make sure to encrypt the values of variables that hold sensitive data.

integrations.title: Integrations
integrations.description: Allows using info from the integrations connected in Codemagic UI. Currently supported: app_store_connect.

cache.title: Cache
cache.description: Define the paths to be cached and stored on Codemagic.

when.title: Conditions for build to continue
when.description: All conditions below should be met in order for build to continue.

working_directory.title: Working directory
working_directory.description: Specify the default directory to run script commands. Each script will be executed inside the specified directory, unless the working directory is specified for the script itself.

pre_clone_scripts.title: Custom pre-clone scripts
pre_clone_scripts.description: Scripts that are executed before the repository is cloned. Using pre-clone scripts you can set up a VPN connection or perform other preliminary tasks that do not require access to application source code.
pre_clone_scripts.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a not empty list of strings (inline script) or dictionaries (scripts with additional fields)

scripts.title: Build scripts
scripts.description: Scripts specify what kind of application is built. This is where you can specify the commands to test, build and code sign your project. You can also run shell (sh) scripts directly in your .yaml file, or run scripts in other languages by defining the language with a shebang line or by launching a script file present in your repository.
scripts.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a not empty list of strings (inline script) or dictionaries (scripts with additional fields)

artifacts.title: Artifacts to be saved
artifacts.description:
Configure the paths and names of the artifacts you would like to use in the following steps, e.g. for publishing, or have available for download on the build page. All paths are relative to the clone directory, but absolute paths are supported as well. You can also use environment variables in artifact patterns.
The pattern can match several files or folders. If it picks up files or folders with the same name, the top level file or folder name will be suffixed with _{number}.
If one of the patterns includes another pattern, duplicate artifacts are not created.
apk, aab, aar, ipa, app, proguard mapping (mapping.txt), flutter_drive.log, jar, zip, xarchive and dSYM.zip files will be available as separate items in the Artifacts section on the build page. The rest of the artifacts will be included in an archive with the following name pattern: {project-name}_{version}_artifacts.zip.
artifacts.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a not empty list of strings, integers, floats or booleans

publishing.title: Publishing and deployment
publishing.description: The matching artifacts will be published to the services you have configured. The available integrations currently are email, Slack, Google Play and App Store Connect. It is also possible to publish elsewhere with custom publishing scripts.

labels.title: Build labels
labels.description: Define label names to easily filter builds in UI. You can use environment variable as well.
labels.errorMessage: Incorrect type. Expected a list of nonempty strings
